item.title: Git Bisect And Perl
item.description: At work we have many developers committing code to a large Git repo, and a huge test suite which runs to check the software builds and operates correctly. Inevitably, developers push commits which break a test or two, and in particularly hectic moments, it can be difficult to figure out “who broke the build”. Enter Git’s bisect command. I feed it the SHA of the earliest bad commit I know of (or “HEAD”) and the SHA of the last working commit:
